segments.text: In this kitchen drawing, everything looks so domestic at first glance.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is polishing that plate with a towel, totally zoned in.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the sink is a disaster, water cascading over the edge.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why hasn't she turned off the faucet? It's flooding the place.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Puddle spreading, soaking her shoes, and she just keeps drying dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Now the kids are up to no good with the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Boy on that rickety stool, stretching way too high.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s tilting back, he could crash down hard.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl’s just waiting eagerly, hand out for her treat.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They’re stealing cookies like little thieves, and mom’s oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside the window, the garden’s all neat and calm.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is infuriating, someone’s going to get hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe they’re ignoring the mess like this.
segments.speaker: PAR
